description:
Long-term extension, beyond 2100,  for the SSP5-3.4 overshoot scenario.  The negative CO2 emissions level reached in 2100 remains constant at that level to 2150 and then  increases linearly to zero by 2250. Concentration-driven. 
The scenario can be seen as an overshoot of the 3.4 W/m2 level (which it exceeds and then returns to by about 2100) and an overshoot of the 2.6 W/m2 level, which it returns to in the 23rd century.
keywords: C4MIP, Tier 2, Scenario, SSP5, RCP3.4 extension, concentration-driven, 1850 CO2 for radiation
long_name: extension of biogeochemically-coupled version of the updated emission-driven RCP3.4 overshoot scenario based on SSP5
rationale: To consider the implications of rapid decarbonisation. To allow investigation of questions related to climate change beyond 2100. To address questions of long term feedbacks and reversibility which might not be apparent from shorter simulations.

requirements.description: Future scenario, begin in 2101 and run for 200 years
requirements.label: 2101-2300 200yrs

requirements.description: Impose RCP3.4 overshoot extension forcing. The negative CO2 emissions level reached in 2100 by SSP5-3.4 remain constant at that level to 2150 and then increase linearly to zero by 2250.
requirements.keywords: Representative Concentration Pathway 3.4 extension overshoot, future, scenario, SSP5, RCP3.4 extension overshoot
requirements.label: RCP34 extension overshoot Forcing

requirements.description: The standard solar forcing dataset recommended for usage is the solar reference scenario dataset which includes future solar forcing (2015-2299).  Includes total solar irradiance, F10.7 cm solar radio flux, and spectral solar irradiance for 10-100000 nm range.
requirements.keywords: Solar Forcing, Future, Solar, Spectral Irradiance, SSI, TSI
requirements.label: Future Solar Irradiance Forcing

requirements.description: Future solar particle forcing (2015-2299). For models with interactive stratospheric chemstiry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair produciont by galactic gosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.
requirements.keywords: Solar forcing, Future, Particle forcing, proton forcing, electron forcing, cosmic ray ionisation
requirements.label: Future Solar Particle Forcing

requirements.description: Initialisation is from the end of the ssp534-over-bgc experiment.
requirements.label: SSP534-over-bgc-Initialisation

requirements.description: Use a fully coupled Earth system model
requirements.label: ESM Configuration
